data.title: SPOTLIGHT: Nina Valenti of NatureVsFuture
data.meta_description: Launched in 2002, NatureVsFuture was formed as an artistic response and eco-conscious approach in the form of apparel. Brooklyn native and Parsons School of Design graduate Nina Valenti fuses classic with cutting edge and deconstructive with refined elegance to create an exciting new look. Blending natural and futurist
data.text:
Launched in 2002, NatureVsFuture was formed as an artistic response and eco-conscious approach in the form of apparel. Brooklyn native and Parsons School of Design graduate Nina Valenti fuses classic with cutting edge and deconstructive with refined elegance to create an exciting new look. Blending natural and futuristic fabric with architectural designs, NVF is a new breed of organic futurism via clothing. It is functional, comfortable, and expertly tailored to fit the body.

Swerve Coat, $598

NatureVsFuture acknowledges the global environmental concerns and the importance of preserving and respecting the earth in the age of modernization.. Organic, sustainable, renewable, biodegradable, recycled and surplus materials are incorporated into each collection.

Asymmetrical Cape and Hood, $328

We first met Nina Valenti at an independent designer market in Nolita. Her aesthetic is consistent and committed Nina has been a part of ID Pop Shop since our first event at Chelsea Market in 2011. We have seen her line develop and we are always excited to see the new designs.

Double Collar Sweater Jacket, $298

Designed in Dumbo, Brooklyn, and locally produced in the Garment District in New York City.
